“The world doesn’t care what you break. It remembers what you build.” —Kael Thorne, Archival Mason of Skyreach You weren’t trained in combat. You were trained in balance, in leverage, in shaping weight into permanence. Whether as a builder, hauler, or structural code-welder, your youth was spent beneath scaffolds or atop sun-baked ridgelines.

Starting Item

Whether you walked the outer dunes or tended relic-shrines, the Veil was never far from you.

Trained Skills

Starting Item

“A name can be redeemed. But only if it’s carried like a blade.” —Thava Rimehand, Blacklist Sentinel Your family bears a mark—betrayal, failure, exile. You weren’t born into glory, but into expectation: to fix what came before. You learned to fight harder, speak less, and carry your shame without complaint. Redemption isn’t given. It’s carved out.

Trained Skills

Starting Item

A broken oath-stone or defaced emblem—kept not as shame, but as reminder.

Starting Talents

“A shield is only heavy if you doubt its purpose.” —Irran Vel-Korr, Warden of the Tern Spire You were raised in the quiet halls of a traditional clan bastion, where each stone bore a name and every sunrise began with stillness. Your life was one of rituals, sparring drills, and the steady hum of ward-chants echoing through reinforced corridors.

Trained Skills

Starting Item

A carved stone amulet or ward-braided arm wrap, passed down by a senior keeper of your hold.

“Judgment is the weight you carry after the blade is put away.” —Ruhm Dask, Nightwatch Captain You were trained for service: a watchtower observer, guard in a sacred enclave, or escort to emissaries across dangerous ground. You learned the value of silence, observation, and standing still while others flinched.

Trained Skills

Starting Item

You were trained by protocols—fed code like food, stories like systems, and magic like firmware. Whether raised by an AI cult or under the blinking gaze of an abandoned cyber-shrine, your world has always been written in loops, glyphs, and gradients of belief.

“Paper burns. A deal doesn’t. Remember that.” —Raiku the Gray, Pactbreaker and Broker You were born under signature and seal—whether by pact, blood, or mercenary code. Loyalty wasn’t given. Starting Talents

You learned to hear both spirit and signal in the quiet—slipping between echoes, ducking ICE traces, reading the weight of silence like a second language.

Trained Skills

Starting Item

“No tail trails the wind. No eye follows the blur.” —Yuna Driftstep, Scout of the Thirteenth Coil You were raised on the move—between rooftops and dead forests, ledges and lightning rails. Yours was a life of silence, sprint, and edge-balancing. The road made you clever. The wind made you quiet. And you never stayed long enough for your footprints to harden.

Trained Skills

Starting Item

Whether your clan upheld a sacred pact or simply honored the memory of the old rites, you grew up on the threshold between the Veil and the waking world—feet bare on stone, heart tuned to the pulse of what hides behind the wind.
